metadata.Title: CVE-2022-47940 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in ksmbd in the Linux kernel 5.15 through 5.18before 5.18.18. fs/ksmbd/smb2pdu.c lacks length validation in thenon-padding case in smb2_write.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-47940` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required
